For<S>1063</S> every<S>3956</S> high priest<S>749</S> taken<S>2983</S> from among<S>1537</S> men<S>444</S> is ordained<S>2525</S> for<S>5228</S> men<S>444</S> in things pertaining to<S>4314</S> God<S>2316</S>, that<S>2443</S> he may offer<S>4374</S> both<S>5037</S> gifts<S>1435</S> and<S>2532</S> sacrifices<S>2378</S> for<S>5228</S> sins<S>266</S>:
Who can<S>1410</S> have compassion<S>3356</S> on the ignorant<S>50</S>, and<S>2532</S> on them that are out of the way<S>4105</S>; for<S>1893</S> that he<S>4029</S> himself<S>846</S> also<S>2532</S> is compassed<S>4029</S> with infirmity<S>769</S>. <sup>can: or, can reasonably bear with</sup>
And<S>2532</S> by reason<S>1223</S> hereof<S>5026</S> he ought<S>3784</S>, as<S>2531</S> for<S>4012</S> the people<S>2992</S>, so<S>3779</S> also<S>2532</S> for<S>4012</S> himself<S>1438</S>, to offer<S>4374</S> for<S>5228</S> sins<S>266</S>.
And<S>2532</S> no<S>3756</S> man<S>5100</S> taketh<S>2983</S> this honour<S>5092</S> unto himself<S>1438</S>, but<S>235</S> he that is called<S>2564</S> of<S>5259</S> God<S>2316</S>, as<S>2509</S> <S>2532</S> was Aaron<S>2</S>.
So<S>3779</S> also<S>2532</S> Christ<S>5547</S> glorified<S>1392</S> not<S>3756</S> himself<S>1438</S> to be made<S>1096</S> an high priest<S>749</S>; but<S>235</S> he that said<S>2980</S> unto<S>4314</S> him<S>846</S>, Thou<S>4771</S> art<S>1488</S> my<S>3450</S> Son<S>5207</S>, to day<S>4594</S> have<S>1080</S> I<S>1473</S> begotten<S>1080</S> thee<S>4571</S>.
As<S>2531</S> he saith<S>3004</S> also<S>2532</S> in<S>1722</S> another<S>2087</S> place, Thou<S>4771</S> art a priest<S>2409</S> for<S>1519</S> ever<S>165</S> after<S>2596</S> the order<S>5010</S> of Melchisedec<S>3198</S>.
Who<S>3739</S> in<S>1722</S> the days<S>2250</S> of his<S>846</S> flesh<S>4561</S>, when he had offered up<S>4374</S> prayers<S>1162</S> and<S>5037</S> <S>2532</S> supplications<S>2428</S> with<S>3326</S> strong<S>2478</S> crying<S>2906</S> and<S>2532</S> tears<S>1144</S> unto<S>4314</S> him that was able<S>1410</S> to save<S>4982</S> him<S>846</S> from<S>1537</S> death<S>2288</S>, and<S>2532</S> was heard<S>1522</S> in that<S>575</S> he feared<S>2124</S>; <sup>in that: or, for his piety</sup>
Though<S>2539</S> he were<S>5607</S> a Son<S>5207</S>, yet learned he<S>3129</S> obedience<S>5218</S> by<S>575</S> the things which<S>3739</S> he suffered<S>3958</S>;
And<S>2532</S> being made perfect<S>5048</S>, he became<S>1096</S> the author<S>159</S> of eternal<S>166</S> salvation<S>4991</S> unto all<S>3956</S> them that obey<S>5219</S> him<S>846</S>;
Called<S>4316</S> of<S>5259</S> God<S>2316</S> an high priest<S>749</S> after<S>2596</S> the order<S>5010</S> of Melchisedec<S>3198</S>.
Of<S>4012</S> whom<S>3739</S> we<S>2254</S> have<S>3056</S> many things<S>4183</S> to say<S>3056</S>, and<S>2532</S> hard<S>1421</S> to be uttered<S>3004</S>, seeing<S>1893</S> ye are<S>1096</S> dull<S>3576</S> of hearing<S>189</S>.
For<S>2532</S> <S>1063</S> when for<S>1223</S> the time<S>5550</S> ye ought<S>3784</S> to be<S>1511</S> teachers<S>1320</S>, ye have<S>2192</S> need<S>5532</S> that one teach<S>1321</S> you<S>5209</S> again<S>3825</S> which<S>5101</S> be the first<S>746</S> principles<S>4747</S> of the oracles<S>3051</S> of God<S>2316</S>; and<S>2532</S> are become such as<S>1096</S> have<S>2192</S> need<S>5532</S> of milk<S>1051</S>, and<S>2532</S> not<S>3756</S> of strong<S>4731</S> meat<S>5160</S>.
For<S>1063</S> every one<S>3956</S> that useth<S>3348</S> milk<S>1051</S> is unskilful<S>552</S> in the word<S>3056</S> of righteousness<S>1343</S>: for<S>1063</S> he is<S>2076</S> a babe<S>3516</S>. <sup>is unskillful: Gr. hath no experience</sup>
But<S>1161</S> strong<S>4731</S> meat<S>5160</S> belongeth to them that are<S>2076</S> of full age<S>5046</S>, even those who by reason<S>1223</S> of use<S>1838</S> have<S>2192</S> their senses<S>145</S> exercised<S>1128</S> to<S>4314</S> discern<S>1253</S> both<S>5037</S> good<S>2570</S> and<S>2532</S> evil<S>2556</S>. <sup>of full age: or, perfect</sup> <sup>use: or, an habit, or, perfection</sup>
